definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Hilary:Do you take naps at noon or feel sleepy?
sentences.chinese: 你白天有睡午觉或是打瞌睡吗？

sentences.english: He dozes in English class once in a while.
sentences.chinese: 他偶尔在英文课打瞌睡。

sentences.english: Somnambulist's memories snooze through the whole event.
sentences.chinese: 梦游病患者的记忆打瞌睡是通过整个事件形成的。

sentences.english: He was drowsing in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 他当时正在花园里打瞌睡。

sentences.english: And eh grasshopper laughs in the merry scene.
sentences.chinese: 欢笑的蝈蝈儿不会在热闹里打瞌睡。

sentences.english: He was dozing in the hammock when I called.
sentences.chinese: 当我造访时他正在帆布吊床上打瞌睡。

sentences.english: Looks like they catch me drowse.
sentences.chinese: 他们好像发觉我在打瞌睡。

sentences.english: Cheng said his favorite class dozing, Bloomberg smiled.
sentences.chinese: 程说他上课最爱打瞌睡，彭博笑了。

sentences.english: Even if you’re the one graduating, it’s a snooze-fest.
sentences.chinese: 即便你就是毕业生本人，那也无聊到想打瞌睡。

sentences.english: The old man was nodding in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 这位老人正坐在椅子上，头向前垂着打瞌睡。

sentences.english: He was snoozing by the table.
I'm just trying to refrain from drowsing at work.
sentences.chinese: 我只是试着别在工作时打瞌睡而已。

sentences.english: If you feel yourself nodding off, open your eyes halfway.
sentences.chinese: 如果你觉得自己开始打瞌睡，就半睁开眼睛。

sentences.english: He often dozes off while he's at work.
sentences.chinese: 他上班时常常都在打瞌睡。

sentences.english: Daytime dozing may enhance a person’s capacity to learn certain tasks.
sentences.chinese: 白天打瞌睡可提高人学习某项特定任务的能力。

sentences.english: He always nodded when watching TV.
sentences.chinese: 一看电视他就会打瞌睡。

definition: erhua variant of 打盹[da3 dun3]
to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
to relax with one's eyes closed
to doze/to take a nap/nodding off to sleep
